http://www.lsoft.com/images/listserv-community.gif http://www.lsoft.com/images/listserv_small.gif ACAD-AE-MED List ACAD-AE-MED List Archives https://www.jiscmail.ac.uk/cgi-bin/webadmin?RSS&L=ACAD-AE-MED&v=ATOM1.0
This is an Atom formatted XML site feed. It is intended to be viewed in a Newsreader. Alternatively you can view the HTML archives at https://www.jiscmail.ac.uk/cgi-bin/webadmin?A0=ACAD-AE-MED.
LISTSERV Web Interface 2.4.1 2015-03-02T11:15:20Z McCormick Simon Dr, Consultant, A&E 2015-03-02T11:14:52+00:00 2015-03-02T11:14:52+00:00 Re: Redditch/Worcestershire consultants https://www.jiscmail.ac.uk:443/cgi-bin/webadmin?A2=ACAD-AE-MED;8e4dc067.1503 Now wouldn't that be interesting!<br><br>Given how the senior managers seem to hop on and off the roundabout every few years, leaving trails of success or failure in their wake, perhaps we should have some form of ePortfolio (official or blackmarket) that follows them and consultants can attach feedback to.<br><br>Simon<br><br>"Hospitals with overcrowded Emergency Departments are overcrowded hospitals that have chosen to manifest the overcrowding in a single location"<br>Full Capacity protocol: an end to double standards in acute hospital care provision Emerg Med J 2011;28:547-549 Steve Meek 2015-02-24T21:44:24+00:00 2015-02-24T21:44:24+00:00 Redditch/Worcestershire consultants https://www.jiscmail.ac.uk:443/cgi-bin/webadmin?A2=ACAD-AE-MED;11936883.1502 Hi All<br>I would be interested to speak to one of the team who recently resigned from the Alexandra Hospital as we seem to have one of their ex managers - a confidential chat would be appreciated..<br>If anyone on the list knows any of them, please would you pass on this message.<br>Thanks Yemisi Takwoingi 2015-02-05T12:53:35+00:00 2015-02-05T12:53:35+00:00 Systematic reviews and meta-analyses of diagnostic test accuracy. 1st to 3rd July 2015, University of Birmingham, UK https://www.jiscmail.ac.uk:443/cgi-bin/webadmin?A2=ACAD-AE-MED;3bb5970f.1502 This three-day course is organised jointly by faculty from the University of Birmingham and the University of Amsterdam. The course is designed for individuals undertaking health technology assessment, health service researchers and healthcare professionals interested in understanding key issues in the design and conduct of systematic reviews and meta-analyses of diagnostic test accuracy (DTA) studies. The course will be delivered through a mixture of interactive presentations, discussions and hands-on computer exercises. [...] McCormick Simon Dr, Consultant, A&E 2015-01-23T10:57:10+00:00 2015-01-23T10:57:10+00:00 Re: CT scans https://www.jiscmail.ac.uk:443/cgi-bin/webadmin?A2=ACAD-AE-MED;4d562cf0.1501 Just done a quick computer search on our system.<br><br>Busy district general hospital. Trauma unit, not trauma centre, so only just getting in to 'full body' trauma scans; plenty of head injuries for CT; stroke thrombolysis including CTing all CVAs/high risk TIAs; occasional CTPAs; occasional other CT for abdominal pathology. Don't know how many were multiple on individual patients (rather than attendances) but given our profile, very few I'd reckon. [...] McCormick Simon Dr, Consultant, A&E 2015-01-23T10:56:32+00:00 2015-01-23T10:56:32+00:00 Re: CT scans https://www.jiscmail.ac.uk:443/cgi-bin/webadmin?A2=ACAD-AE-MED;71ce71bf.1501 Just done a quick computer search on our system.<br><br>Busy district general hospital. Trauma unit, not trauma centre, so only just getting in to 'full body' trauma scans; plenty of head injuries for CT; stroke thrombolysis including CTing all CVAs/high risk TIAs; occasional CTPAs; occasional other CT for abdominal pathology. Don't know how many were multiple on individual patients (rather than attendances) but given our profile, very few I'd reckon. [...] Jel Coward 2015-01-22T17:53:46-08:00 2015-01-22T17:53:46-08:00 CT scans https://www.jiscmail.ac.uk:443/cgi-bin/webadmin?A2=ACAD-AE-MED;1010ff1.1501 Hi all<br><br>Recent paper in CJEM November (Canadian Journal of Emergency Medicine)<br><br>Looking at 2 urban EDs (Ottawa as I recall)<br><br>1 in 7 visits to ED results in at least one CT scan.<br><br>How does this compare with the UK?<br><br>Cheers :) Coats Tim - Professor of Emergency Medicine 2015-01-20T11:15:27+00:00 2015-01-20T11:15:27+00:00 FW: NIHR-funded study - Decision making regarding thrombolysis in acute stroke - Prize draw for new iPad https://www.jiscmail.ac.uk:443/cgi-bin/webadmin?A2=ACAD-AE-MED;f7c6837.1501 Dear all,<br>If you are making the final decision in stroke thrombolysis could you please spend 20 minutes participating in this research study. Closing date is 14th February.<br>At present we have few EPs responding - maybe this reflects reality, but if you do stroke thrombolysis please click the link!<br>Many thanks,<br>Tim. Coats [...] Shane Curran 2014-12-31T01:36:38+11:00 2014-12-31T01:36:38+11:00 Re: Consultant Working Conditions https://www.jiscmail.ac.uk:443/cgi-bin/webadmin?A2=ACAD-AE-MED;ea899951.1412 theres the bit of me that wants to go 'shit thats awful \ufffd\ufffd\ufffd<br>and then theres the director bit of me that says<br>\ufffd\ufffd\ufffdhell I\ufffd\ufffd\ufffdve got jobs in Wagga that are way better than that!\ufffd\ufffd\ufffd<br>1 evening a week i weekend in 4 25% clinical support time and a new department next year<br>and teaching appointments if you want them<br>and 5 weeks study leave with enough money to go back to the UK business class [...] James Connolly 2014-12-24T18:56:02-05:00 2014-12-24T18:56:02-05:00 Re: Consultant Working Conditions https://www.jiscmail.ac.uk:443/cgi-bin/webadmin?A2=ACAD-AE-MED;8ad3dae.1412 agree in principle with a lot of what Mark said except .... 1 " non critical over 70 should bypass" I find this is increasingly our workload.... of these " non - critical" some are seriously ill and unrecognised as such - who is applying this bypass criteria ? - we have already established it is not primary care - is it the nurse triage ?? is it paramedics?? either way we are consigning a large number of YOUNG patients to die.... If a 70 year old and 1 day patient with an unrecognised treatable condition e.g. AAA is sent [...] Prescott Mark 2014-12-24T16:41:49-00:00 2014-12-24T16:41:49-00:00 Re: Consultant Working Conditions https://www.jiscmail.ac.uk:443/cgi-bin/webadmin?A2=ACAD-AE-MED;8d6fb003.1412 Having read your account - which resonates greatly within the 2<br>departments here I circulated your letter to my Consultant colleagues.<br><br>I enclose one response (with the author's consent)<br><br>Thanks Mark<br><br>Some solutions<br><br>(1) All non-critical ambulance cases over 70 should bypass A&E and go<br>direct to a geriatric assessment unit - these patients cannot be<br>properly assessed in 4hrs and they are not helped by being clerked in<br>A&E and again in hospital. This would halve the number of major cases<br>seen in A&E [...] Phillip O'Connor 2014-12-24T12:54:30+00:00 2014-12-24T12:54:30+00:00 Re: Consultant Working Conditions https://www.jiscmail.ac.uk:443/cgi-bin/webadmin?A2=ACAD-AE-MED;c91f6feb.1412 Bah humbug Sent from my Sony Xperia\ufffd\ufffd\ufffd smartphone ---- Phillip O'Connor wrote ---- >Bma have been asked to negotiate on a one size fits all, Bma have failed emergency medicine in the UK in my opinion. >I don't get to opt out of weekends yet as Simon rightly points out, in my experience occasionally I'm the least paid member of medical staff on an antisocial shift with the most responsibility, while the gps fire in the tonsillitis "?meningitis" and avoid risk. > >I would advocate an open debate on where we are going. Recruitment of trainees not good enough, sustainability [...] Phillip O'Connor 2014-12-24T12:24:50+00:00 2014-12-24T12:24:50+00:00 Re: Consultant Working Conditions https://www.jiscmail.ac.uk:443/cgi-bin/webadmin?A2=ACAD-AE-MED;e4b49682.1412 Bma have been asked to negotiate on a one size fits all, Bma have failed emergency medicine in the UK in my opinion. I don't get to opt out of weekends yet as Simon rightly points out, in my experience occasionally I'm the least paid member of medical staff on an antisocial shift with the most responsibility, while the gps fire in the tonsillitis "?meningitis" and avoid risk. I would advocate an open debate on where we are going. Recruitment of trainees not good enough, sustainability questionable, and let's face it if Em dies the Nhs engine dies. If we [...] Coats Tim - Professor of Emergency Medicine 2014-12-24T11:42:39+00:00 2014-12-24T11:42:39+00:00 Re: Consultant Working Conditions https://www.jiscmail.ac.uk:443/cgi-bin/webadmin?A2=ACAD-AE-MED;dac1142e.1412 Things we have done in Leicester to try and make a sustainable career for consultants:<br><br>1) Created an annualised rota to give both accountability and flexability. This is a vital part of controlling the clinical workload.<br>2) Created a line in the sand of 1 in 8 nights that we will not go below (more than one night shift a week is not long term sustainable).<br>3) Accepted the principle that ED consultants need to have an area of special interest within their job plan, for example education, governance, research. (The key part here is that the time is within [...] McCormick Simon Dr, Consultant, A&E 2014-12-23T14:22:55+00:00 2014-12-23T14:22:55+00:00 Consultant Working Conditions https://www.jiscmail.ac.uk:443/cgi-bin/webadmin?A2=ACAD-AE-MED;87f53f67.1412 Would love to hear how others are finding working as a consultant at the moment. Locally the creaking systems have finally hit the tipping point in to crisis and many of you have already passed that point whilst some of you have yet to get there. What is that doing to our working patterns, our working conditions and our life outside of the shop floor? [...] Experimental Therapeutics 2014-12-01T15:47:57+00:00 2014-12-01T15:47:57+00:00 Accepting applications - Experimental Therapeutics courses https://www.jiscmail.ac.uk:443/cgi-bin/webadmin?A2=ACAD-AE-MED;633bcc31.1412 Professional Development at Oxford University<br><br>http://www.conted.ox.ac.uk<br><br>Experimental Therapeutics Programme<br><br>MSc in Experimental Therapeutics - commencing October 2015<br><br>Short courses in Experimental Therapeutics - 2014\ufffd\ufffd\ufffd2015<br><br>MSc in Experimental Therapeutics (http://www.conted.ox.ac.uk/courses/details.php?id=136&course=professional&course_area=Experimental%20therapeutics&course_area_id=211)<br><br>Commencing October 2015<br><br>The MSc in Experimental Therapeutics is a flexible part-time course designed for health professionals and researchers, and offers a unique opportunity to gain an understanding of the principles that underpin clinical research and to translate this into good practice. [...] Philippa Bevan 2014-10-21T13:39:12+01:00 2014-10-21T13:39:12+01:00 Use of ultrasound and ultrasound guided procedures in emergency medicine https://www.jiscmail.ac.uk:443/cgi-bin/webadmin?A2=ACAD-AE-MED;72d5e8c8.1410 Dear All,<br><br>I am working on a product development project for Loughborough University.<br>The University requires some very basic insight into the use of ultrasound<br>in the pre-hospital and emergency/A&E setting. In particular, we are looking<br>to better understand whether ultrasound guided procedures may occur in these<br>settings.<br><br>If you would be willing to complete a very short online survey on this<br>subject, please use the link below. The survey will require 2-3 minutes to<br>complete and will help with some early decision making with regards to<br>moving the project forward. Your responses will be collected anonymously and<br>will not [...] Jel Coward 2014-10-02T09:25:35-07:00 2014-10-02T09:25:35-07:00 Re: Trauma mattresses https://www.jiscmail.ac.uk:443/cgi-bin/webadmin?A2=ACAD-AE-MED;c1f2b593.1410 ....can you beleive that we don't have these (vacuum mattreses) in<br>Canada? Well, they are available and we have one in our Search and Rescue<br>team but the ambulance service don't have them....in BC at least.<br><br>Cheers<br><br>jel<br><br>On 1 October 2014 23:31, Rowley Cottingham <rowley@emergencyunit.com> wrote:<br><br>> Leave them in the vacuum mattress. Our physicists ran tests that showed<br>> they<br>> had a similar radiation absorption to a man's shirt.<br>><br>> -----Original Message-----<br>> From: Accident and Emergency Academic List<br>> [mailto:ACAD-AE-MED@JISCMAIL.AC.UK] On Behalf Of Blackham Julian (NORTH<br>> BRISTOL NHS TRUST)<br>> Sent: 01 October 2014 [...] Ryan, Damien 2014-10-02T13:09:13+01:00 2014-10-02T13:09:13+01:00 Re: [MAYBE SPAM] Re: Trauma mattresses https://www.jiscmail.ac.uk:443/cgi-bin/webadmin?A2=ACAD-AE-MED;9181db14.1410 Description:<br>http://www.grouleff-aps.dk/products/ct-trolleys/g111203-2050-ct-trolley-acitos.html<br><br>WE are considering these trolleys with removable carbonfibre tables for use in our new ED<br><br>regards<br><br>Dr. Damien Ryan MRCSI, MRCSEd(A&E), DIMC, FCEM<br>Consultant in Emergency Medicine<br>Retrieval, Emergency and Disaster Medicine Research and Development Unit (REDSPoT)<br>Emergency Department, University Hospital Limerick, Dooradoyle, Limerick<br>Tel: +353 61-482775 Fax: +353 61-482493 Mob: +353 86-412 2657<br>Local Injuries Unit, UL Hospitals, Nenagh Hospital, Co. Tipperary<br>Tel: +353 67-42311 Fax +353 67-42346<br>damien.ryan@hse.ie [...] PAC Doctors 2014-10-02T08:57:00+01:00 2014-10-02T08:57:00+01:00 Re: Trauma mattresses https://www.jiscmail.ac.uk:443/cgi-bin/webadmin?A2=ACAD-AE-MED;44de72cc.1410 Wouldn't do without these in Leeds<br><br>http://www.wolverson.uk.com/TRAUMA-TRANSFER-SYSTEM_B222QK2.aspx<br><br>Not cheap, and covers cost too but hugely improved slickness to CT and onwards<br><br>Sent from my iPad<br><br>> On 2 Oct 2014, at 07:31, Rowley Cottingham <rowley@EMERGENCYUNIT.COM> wrote:<br>><br>> Leave them in the vacuum mattress. Our physicists ran tests that showed they<br>> had a similar radiation absorption to a man's shirt.<br>><br>> -----Original Message-----<br>> From: Accident and Emergency Academic List<br>> [mailto:ACAD-AE-MED@JISCMAIL.AC.UK] On Behalf Of Blackham Julian (NORTH<br>> BRISTOL NHS TRUST)<br>> Sent: 01 October 2014 22:07<br>> To: ACAD-AE-MED@JISCMAIL.AC.UK<br>> Subject: Trauma mattresses<br>><br>> I [...] Brown, Ruth 2014-10-02T07:55:52+00:00 2014-10-02T07:55:52+00:00 FW: [MAYBE SPAM] Re: [MAYBE SPAM] Re: Trauma mattress https://www.jiscmail.ac.uk:443/cgi-bin/webadmin?A2=ACAD-AE-MED;493e3ae2.1410 Thanks Jonathan for this<br><br>http://www.wolverson.uk.com/PADDED-TRANSFER-TROLLEY-MATTRESS_AZH64.aspx?nh=222672<br><br>this is the \ufffd\ufffd\ufffdsimple\ufffd\ufffd\ufffd one \ufffd\ufffd\ufffd cheap and easy to use \ufffd\ufffd\ufffd there is a more advanced one but more difficult to use.<br><br>We have 5 of them \ufffd\ufffd\ufffd used them for 3 years now and very pleased with them<br>You have to replace them from time to time as the covers get worn with the cleaning etc. but still worth it<br>Regards Ruth<br>IMPERIAL COLLEGE HEALTHCARE NHS TRUST NOTICE: This message may contain confidential information and is intended only for the individual named. If you are not the person or entity that it is [...] Brown, Ruth 2014-10-02T06:49:09+00:00 2014-10-02T06:49:09+00:00 Re: [MAYBE SPAM] Re: Trauma mattresses https://www.jiscmail.ac.uk:443/cgi-bin/webadmin?A2=ACAD-AE-MED;14b711f9.1410 We have radiolucent stiff mattresses that slide on and off etc. I will dig out manufacturer and circulate. 200% recommend them. Our physicists ran tests that showed they<br>had a similar radiation absorption to a man's shirt.<br><br>-----Original Message-----<br>From: Accident and Emergency Academic List<br>[mailto:ACAD-AE-MED@JISCMAIL.AC.UK] On Behalf Of Blackham Julian (NORTH<br>BRISTOL NHS TRUST)<br>Sent: 01 October 2014 22:07<br>To: ACAD-AE-MED@JISCMAIL.AC.UK<br>Subject: Trauma mattresses<br><br>I am looking at trying to find a more efficient way of moving trauma<br>patients onto and off the CT Table. We have looked at using a 'CT Safe'<br>scoop stretcher, but our neuroradiologists and medical physicists say they<br>need 30% higher dose of radiation to get the same image [...] Blackham Julian (NORTH BRISTOL NHS TRUST) 2014-10-01T22:07:24+01:00 2014-10-01T22:07:24+01:00 Trauma mattresses https://www.jiscmail.ac.uk:443/cgi-bin/webadmin?A2=ACAD-AE-MED;c13e9756.1410 I am looking at trying to find a more efficient way of moving trauma patients onto and off the CT Table. We have looked at using a ‘CT Safe’ scoop stretcher, but our neuroradiologists and medical physicists say they need 30% higher dose of radiation to get the same image quality using a scoop rather than without a scoop. [...]
